results.title: Under the volcano
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Wieland Schulz-Keil, Moritz Borman and Ithaca-Conacine
results.brief_description: Albert Finney and Jacqueline Bisset combine to bring Malcolm Lowry’s powerful, critically acclaimed novel to the screen with all its imagery, symbolism, insight and passion. A despairing alcoholic British ex-consul in a small Mexican town goes on a drunken odyssey on the local day of the dead. During the intense dramatic twenty four hours he is distracted but not really diverted from his downward descent into damnation. The vivid brutal action is shocking and the tragic self absorption haunting. Also stars Anthony Andrews.

results.title: A Day in the death of Joe Egg
results.creator_credit: Peter Medak, David Deutsch, Domino and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Alan Bates and Janet Suzman give exceptional performances in this unforgettable story. Based on the play by Peter Nichols, it centres around Bri and Sheila, an English couple struggling to cope with and raise their only child - a severely handicapped young girl named Jo with whom they cannot communicate. Much to the dismay of friends and relatives, who continually recommend having Jo institutionalised, the couple choose to care for their daughter in their own modest apartment. Although they try to maintain their sense of humour, the difficulty and the seeming futility of their efforts takes an emotional toll that eventually threatens to destroy their marriage. A vivid portrait of two caring individuals faced with an almost impossible situation.

results.title: La Balance (S)
results.creator_credit: Bob Swaim, Films A2 and Les Film Ariane
results.brief_description: Heightened crime and increased prosititution in the streets of Paris, force the criminal investigation department to set up a special unit of police called the Territorial Brigades. Their only hope of penetrating the French Maffia is through a network of informers but the perfect informer is killed and another must be found from the pimps and prostitutes of the French underground. Voted the best film of the year in France at the time of its release, La Balance is a world of violence where only the tough survive. This version is dubbed in English.

results.title: The Big country (S)
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Gregory Peck, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The Big country is a western epic that has it all: a classic story, an all-star cast and the impeccable direction of Academy Award winning veteran, William Wyler. Gregory Peck stars as a sea captain who trades the expanse of the oceans for the open range of the West and grows to regret his choice. Charlton Heston is the menacing ranch foreman who loves the land and has a keen eye on McKay’s fiancee (Carroll Baker). The superlative cast is rounded out by Burl Ives in an Oscar winning role, Jean Simmons, Charles Bickford and Chuck Connors.

results.title: Camille
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Turner Entertainment and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Her beauty is the stuff of Hollywood legends, her voice pure magic. Screen legend, Greta Garbo is captured at the very summit of her career. In one of the most romantic tales ever put on film, Garbo is breathtaking as the doomed courtesan whose passion for romance is equalled only by her passion for life. From her first appearance in the luxurious carriage that sweeps her off to the opera, to her last gasp in the arms of her broken hearted lover, Garbo’s performance makes an indelible impression. As Armand Duval, her ardent suitor, Robert Taylor cuts a striking figure that makes the futility of his love all the more poignant. The supporting roles are similarly cast with uncanny accuracy. Lionel Barrymore is commanding as Armand’s well-meaning father; Henry Daniell chills one’s blood with his sadistic portrayal of the Baron de Varville.

results.title: Dark angel
results.creator_credit: Sidney A. Franklin, Samuel Goldwyn and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Set against the backdrop of a World War I ravaged England, this superbly acted romantic drama is a true classic. Merle Oberon is a revelation as a reformed vamp torn between two men - Herbert Marshall and Frederic March, the latter having returned from the war blinded. The script was adapted by Lillian Hellman from the play by Guy Bolton (a.k.a R. B. Trevelyan).

results.title: Dr Petiot
results.creator_credit: Christian de Chalonge, Philippe Chapelier-Dehesdin, Alain Sarde, Canal+, Cine 5, Sara Films and MS Productions
results.brief_description: Michel Serrault gives an extraordinary perfomance as ‘Dr Petiot’, a serial killer who lured Jews into his trap by offering them protection from the Nazis. The film’s expressionistic quality, emphasised by the heavy make-up of Petiot, and the deep focus photography, gives the film a nightmare quality reminiscent of the early German silent horror films. Indeed the film opens with scenes from one such film, plunging us into a world of evil. Based on a true character, Serrault’s perfomance is chilling.

results.title: Carve her name with pride
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Daniel M. Angel and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on R.J. Minney’s novel this inspiring true story of war heroine, Violette Szabo, who volunteered to be parachuted into France as a secret agent to re-organise a shattered resistance group. Virginia McKenna gives the performance of her career as the courageous secret agent, and this magnificent film ensures that no-one will forget Violette’s bravery and conviction in what she believed in most - freedom from tyranny. Also stars Paul Scofield, Jack Warner, Denise Grey and Maurice Ronet.

results.title: The Endless summer
results.creator_credit: Bruce Brown and Bruce Brown Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Golden years of surf collection”.
The archetypal surfing film of the 1960’s, Bruce Brown defied all odds to produce one of the most successful feature-length documentary films in movie history. Filmed on locations world-wide, with diverting tongue-in- cheek narrative by Brown, we follow two surfers’ quest for the ultimate wave. The heady surfing days of the sixties are forever captured in this classic.

group.title: The Golden years of surf collection

results.title: The Girl can't help it
results.creator_credit: Frank Tashlin and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This wonderfully farcical comedy is the first big budget rock and roll movie of the fifties and features seventeen great songs of the era. Tom Ewell plays a down and out agent who is hired by a mobster to make a star out of his sex-pot girlfriend (Jayne Mansfield). Ewell gives her a rock and roll act in the hope of making the big time but Jayne yearns for the simple life and complications set in when she falls for Ewell, while searching for the perfect husband. Includes Little Richard, Eddie Cochran, Gene Vincent, Platters, Fats Domino and more. Also stars Edmond O’Brien.
